author: Bill Birtch
content: I visited this image earlier today and I spent a very long time staring into it, trying to figure out why I found it so intriguing but I had no answers.  I knew it was moody and it made me uneasy but there was more to it than that.  Now, revisiting it I was immediately struck by its cinematic quality.  Maybe that's because I watched a 2 1/2 hour film about Stanley Kubrick, or maybe not.  Anyway, like good cinema, this is evocative and I love it.
